images.copyright: Annual Schwäbisch Hall Weihnachtsmarkt in the market square, Baden-Württemberg, Germany (© sack/Getty Images Plus)
images.title: It’s Weihnachtsmarkt time!
images.caption: It’s Weihnachtsmarkt time!
images.desc: The streets of this market square are all decked out in a tradition which started nearly 700 years ago. Weihnachtsmarkts or Christkindlmarkts (Christmas markets, if you prefer less of a mouthful), take place around the world but they originated in Germany as a celebratory way to observe Advent, the Christian season leading up to Christmas Eve. These markets are generally open-air attractions where everything is decorated, including the trees (called Tannenbaums in German, if they're firs).
